item.description:
Sprawling across the southern sections of Plymouth and Carver, Myles Standish State Forest is the largest publicly owned recreation area in southeastern Massachusetts.

Hike will be about 3 hours with plenty of stops for sights and rest along the way. Be sure to bring lunch / snacks and plenty of water to stop along the way. Hiking boots recommended.

CARPOOLING highly suggested, please post in your RSVP if you'd like to drive and/or carpool. Meet at the forest headquarters parking lot - see map.

PARK DIRECTIONS

From the North: Take Rte. 3 south to exit 5, turn right onto Long Pond Rd. (west) and continue for about 3 miles to the park entrance on the right.

From Rte. 495: Take Rte. 495 to exit 2 (South Carver) and the intersection with Rte. 58. Take Rte. 58 north on Cranberry Rd., follow signs.

From Southeast: Rte.3 north to exit#3. Left off of ramp. Right onto Long Pond Rd, 2 miles forest entrance.

Very low temps or rain cancel - please check website before you leave. We will wait 10 minutes so if your running late please call 508-415-0590.

Dogs welcome
item.name: Hike at Myles Standish State Forest
